intro: Iris spuria, commonly known as the slender iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring grass-like basal leaves and a spike of blue to violet flowers. The flowers have three upright petals and three spreading sepals, with a distinctive spur at the base of the petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
